FuncDef:
The authentication-name command configures a username and a password for a RADIUS server group used by a dynamic CGN global address pool.
The undo authentication-name command cancels the configuration.
By default, no username or password is configured for a RADIUS server group used by a dynamic CGN global address pool.
CLIs: undo authentication-name [ authentication-name [ password cipher [ password ] ] ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an authentication username.
The value is a string of 1 to 253 case-sensitive characters.

Specifies an authentication password.
The value can be a simple text password ranging from 1 to 16 characters or a ciphertext password of 48 characters. The encryption mode is AES256.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When the address usage of a dynamic global address pool reaches the upper threshold, the CGN device requests address segments from a RADIUS server. In this case, a username and a password must be configured for the CGN device to access a RADIUS server in a RADIUS server group.
Prerequisites
The RADIUS server group already exists.
Configuration Impact
After the configuration, the CGN device checks whether address segments are contained in a dynamic address pool. If no address segment is detected, the CGN device applies for an address segment. If a local address segment exists, it cannot be deleted, and only a password can be modified.
Precautions
The authentication username and password cannot be deleted if a dynamic address segment exists locally or when a device is applying for an address segment.
